content.question: An object is pushed into a nonideal spring, compressing the spring. The magnitude of the force <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> the spring exerts on the object as a function of the compression <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown in the graph. Which of the following graphs best shows the potential energy of the object-spring system as a function of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a scatterplot with 6 data points in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x, in meters and the vertical axis is labeled U, in joules. The first data point is located at the origin, and the data points trend diagonally upwards and to the right.

The figure presents a scatterplot with 6 data points in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x, in meters and the vertical axis is labeled U, in joules. The first data point is located approximately three quarters of the way up the vertical axis above the origin, and the data points trend diagonally downwards and to the right.

The figure presents a scatterplot with 6 data points in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x, in meters and the vertical axis is labeled U, in joules. The first data point is located at the origin, and the data points curve upwards and to the right at an increasing rate, moving more steeply as the curve progresses.

The figure presents a scatterplot with 6 data points in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x, in meters and the vertical axis is labeled U, in joules. The first data point is located at the origin, and the data points curve upwards and to the right at a decreasing rate, moving less steeply as the curve progresses.

The figure presents a scatterplot with 6 data points in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x, in meters and the vertical axis is labeled U, in joules. The first data point is located approximately three quarters of the way up the vertical axis above the origin, and the data points curve downwards and to the right at a decreasing rate, moving less steeply as the curve progresses.

content.answer: The figure presents a scatterplot with 6 data points in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x, in meters and the vertical axis is labeled U, in joules. The first data point is located at the origin, and the data points curve upwards and to the right at an increasing rate, moving more steeply as the curve progresses.
